result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian D. Kraus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after evaluation from prison administration to determine if he is appropriate to be enrolled in this program

superMiscConds.notes:
*Restitution to Acuity Insurance of $10,432.79
*Restitution to Cincinnati Insurance Co. of $2,997.67
*Restitution to Dollar General of $16,385.58 - to be paid first

*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

*Do not be in possession of any lighters, matches, flammable liquids, etc. without your agent's prior knowledge or permission
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not enter or be on the premises of any tavern, bar or other facility where the primary source of income is from the sale of and/or distribution of alcoholic beverages except within the scope of your employment and only if agent gives prior consent

*No contact with Dollar General or their employees unless they indicate they would like contact, then need agent approval
*Write letter of apology to Dollar General and provide to agent to forward 
*Comply with any and all recommended psychological counseling/treatment, including taking medications, if recommended by a physcian 
*Comply with other assessments, treatment and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compass assessment and the Department of Corrections
*Sign all appropriate releases of information forms for offender's assessments, medications/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment so agent can monitor compliance  
*Take medication as prescribled by your physician 
*Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge.
*Make regular payments towards court ordered restitution.  If sentenced to prison, a portion of the wages shall go towards restitution.  To be determined by the Department of Corrections. 
*Provide DNA sample if not already done so

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing held on December 21, 2016
to PSI - Confidential
Statement from defendant provided to all parties at time of sentencing.

Defendant Brian D. Kraus in court with attorney William R. F. Ackell. Defendant Brian D. Kraus in custody. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:36  p.m.  Court calls the case
Atty Molepske states the appearances.
State has complied with victim notification; victim appears in Court and makes a statement.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court received a memorandum to the PSI on December 19, 2016 and copies had been provided to the parties.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
State does not have any changes/corrections on the PSI/Memorandum.
Defense indicates that a change/correction on Page 5 of the PSI and states this on the record.
Neither party will be providing any evidence.
1:39 a.m.  N. Calderon makes a statement on behalf of herself and Dollar General.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
1:55 p.m.  Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
2:02 p.m.  Atty Molepske makes clarification of age of defendnat at the time of the incident.
Court takes a moment to read the statement provided by the defendant.
Defendant makes a brief statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose prison sentence of 12 years with -
3 years initial confinement
Credit of 585 days 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program after evaluation from prison administration to determine if he is appropriate to be enrolled in this program
9 years extended supervision
**Conditions of Extended Supervision:
*No contact with Dollar General or their employees unless they indcate they would like contact without approval from agent
*Write letter of apology to Dollary General and provide to agent to forward
*Do not be in possession of any lighters, matches, flammable liquids, etc. without your agent's prior knowledge or permission
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not enter or be on the premises of any tavern, bar or other facility where the primary source of income is from the sale of and/or distribution of alcoholic beverages except within scope of your employment and only if agent gives prior consent.
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
*Comply with any and all recommended psychological counseling/treatment, including taking medication if recommended by a physician
*Compy with any other assessments, treatment and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compass assessment and the Department of Corrections
*Sign appropriate releases of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment so agent can monitor compliance
*Take medication as prescribed by a physician
*Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge.
*Make regular payments towards court-ordered restitution.  If sentenced to prison, a portion of the wages shall go towards restitution.  To be determined by the DOC.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.  
*Provide DNA sample, if not already done so
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay restitiution in the amount of $29,796.04 to be paid during the period of probation:
**Acuity Insurance $10,432.79
**Cincinnati Insurance Co. $2,997.67
**Dollar General $16,385.58 - to be paid first

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian D. Kraus in court with attorney William R. F. Ackell. Defendant Brian D. Kraus in custody. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF-189 and 15CF-348.

10:29 AM Court calls cases.
Court addressess rights and understandings for this section of the day for Defendants scheduled for 10:30 am.

10:35 AM Atty Molepske states appearances.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court, there is a plea agreement in this case.
There had been a prior NGI plea undertaken by Atty McFarland.  This will be withdrawn and will be entering a plea today.

15CF-189: Defendant will plead to Count 1. State recommends 13 yrs prison - 4 yrs initial and 9 yrs extended. Defense is free to argue and parties will be requesting a PSI.

State moves 15CF-348 dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes.

Atty Ackell concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Court informs Defendant of charge and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST for Count 1 in 15CF-189.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Ackell for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
Court takes a moment to re-review the complaint.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-189: Count 1: Arson of Building
15CF-348: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a PSI.
PSI to be completed and provided to the parties at least one week prior to sentencing.

Court will allow parties to double check to make sure sentencing hrg date will work.

Court questions Defense regarding withdrawal of NGI plea.

BY THE COURT:
Court accepts the withdrawal.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on October 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Status conference at 11-23-2015 09:00 am

9:57 a.m. Defendant Brian D. Kraus in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Brian D. Kraus in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty McFarland states there is a conflict with respresenting the Defendant.  Atty McFarland states in case 15CF189 that the Defendant will be changing his plea of Not Guilty to NGI.  BTC: NGI is entered. NGI examination by 11-02-15. Motion to Withdrawal of Atty McFarland is granted and public defender office has assigned Atty Wallace to the case.
  Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
to Change Plea from Not Guilty to NGI

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

3:14 p.m. Defendant Brian D. Kraus in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Brian D. Kraus in custody. DA Molepski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing at 06-08-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Brian D. Kraus appeared by video. Attorney Anne Renc in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
File cannot be assigned to Judge Finn as Louis Molepske is the DA handling the case.

11:32 am
DA #15PT888
d.o.b. 08-31-1996
ADA Knaapen  appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Arson of Building w/out Owner's Consent.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $25,000 cash bond  with conditions as stated.  Not be on the premises of Dollar General an no contact with the Dollar General's employees even during confinement.  No possession of flamable liquids.

BTC:  $25,000 cash bond:  Not be on the premises of Dollar General an no contact with the Dollar General's employees even during confinement.  No possession of lighter or other flamable liquids.
